Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Analyze the Request Context Order-to-Cash process Standard Logic Receive Order Check Inventory If OK Authorize Payment Package Items Ship Order Close Order If Not OK Cancel Order Close Order Provided Model Process Tree pseudocode Problem underfitting Task identify trace allowed by model invalid domain

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Analyze the Provided Process Tree Model root SEQUENCE receive_order check_inventory xor_node close_order xor_node XOR successful_subtree cancel_subtree successful_subtree PARALLEL authorize_payment package_items ship_order cancel_subtree SEQUENCE cancel_order close_order

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If xor_node selects cancel_subtree flow Receive Check Cancel Close Close from root Result Two Close Order activities

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: successful_subtree PARALLEL authorize_payment package_items ship_order PARALLEL means children any order Domain You cannot Ship before Package Should not Ship before Authorize Payment Model allows Ship_Order before Package_Items or Authorize_Payment

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Trace Receive_Order Check_Inventory Ship_Order Package_Items Authorize_Payment Close_Order Model allows because PARALLEL Domain invalid cannot ship before packaging

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Alternative Trace Receive_Order Check_Inventory Cancel_Order Close_Order Close_Order Model allows because close_order in cancel_subtree and root Domain invalid close only once

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Decision weighing Double Close vs Parallel Ordering re-evaluating which better for natural order of operations Parallel fits order violation Double Close cardinality violation

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Prompt asks violates natural order of operations Shipping before packaging is order violation Double Close is state violation Choose Parallel Ordering as primary

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final check trace fits model Receive Check Ship Pack Auth in PARALLEL then Close yes Fits domain no because Ship before Pack and before Auth violates standard logic
